result.execSummary:
The defendant Bryan-Daniel J Robel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid within 90 days or penalty of 5 days Jail, with work release, for non-payment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bryan-Daniel J Robel

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Bryan-Daniel J Robel in court with attorney Jeffrey John Szczewski.  Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant pleads no contest to count #1.  Court finds the defendant guilty of count #1.  Count #2 is dismissed and read in.  State makes recommendations.  Attorney Bayer makes statements.  Defendant makes statements.  Motions withdrawn.  

Court orders the following:  

FINE:  $505.00 to be paid within 90 days, failure to pay will result in 5 days jail with work release.  

NO DNA.
Motion hearing on November 4, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Case called for the defendant's motion to dismiss.  Defendant Bryan-Daniel J Robel in court with attorney Jeffrey John Szczewski.  Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties make initial statements.  Attorney Bayer advises he is not prepared for this motion today and states he didn't know this motion was scheduled for today.  Court advises this matter was made extremely clear that the motion would be heard today.  Court ordered if there were going to be witnesses that they were to be present today.  Court advises the DA's office was advised on the 13th that the Court was going to hear this matter today.  Attorney Bayer advises he didn't have enough time to prepare for this motion.  Court makes record regarding who the witnesses would be for this hearing.  Attorney Bayer makes statements as to possible witnesses.  Court finds there is enough evidence to hold this motion.  Court has no choice but to adjourn this matter. Court expects everyone to be prepared at the next hearing.  Motion hearing scheduled for November 4, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Bryan-Daniel J Robel in court with attorney Jeffrey John Szczewski.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State moves for an adjournment to hold the motion hearing.  Court will handle this motion on Tuesday morning at 8:30 am.  Court takes the trial off the calendar.  Motion hearing scheduled for October 18, 2016 at 08:30 am.
to dismiss filed by Attorney Szczewski, dated 10/10/2016.

Court grants the adjournment.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for October 18, 2016 at 09:00 am.  Jury status hearing scheduled for October 13, 2016 at 08:30 am.
